bwwExcerpt: All of which brings us to the Broadway transfer of "Jagged Little Pill," which originated at the American Repertory Theater in Cambridge, Mass., and whose marquee declares it to be "inspired by" Alanis Morissette's grunge-flavored pop album about teenage love and life. Most of the songs, co-written by Ms. Morissette and Glen Ballard, come from the album, whose release in 1995 led Rolling Stone to dub Ms. Morissette "Queen of Alt-Rock Angst."
